subject: Sales
title: The Flinch
description: A quick, practical guide to The Flinch.

hook.text: The seller names a price. You gasp, wince, lean back slightly. Their confidence drops instantly.

buildup.text: The flinch is a theatrical reaction designed to make the other side doubt their own offer.

discovery.text: It works because humans scan for disapproval constantly. A visible flinch triggers self-doubt.

twist.text: Experienced negotiators expect the flinch. They state the price and sit in complete silence.

climax.text: Use it sparingly. A genuine reaction earns concessions. An overdone flinch looks amateur.

punchline.text: Sometimes a gasp is worth more than any argument.

quiz.question: Why does the 'flinch' tactic work?
options: It triggers self-doubt in the other side
